Terkuak! Ini Sebab Merpati Tak Kunjung Dapat Suntikan Modal Investor
04 Nov 2019, 13:22 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Foto: Tim Infografis: Nadia Permatasari

Jakarta - PT Merpati Nusantara Airlines (Persero) atau MNA tak kunjung terbang hingga saat ini. Sebab, untuk bisa terbang Merpati mesti mendapat suntikan modal dari investor.Sementara, investor yakni PT Intra Asia Corpora yang berniat menyuntik modal Rp 6,4 triliun tak kunjung masuk karena belum ada keputusan untuk pelepasan saham atau privatisasi."Iya lah. Ini bukan kesimpulan ya. Bukan privatisasi dulu baru investor masuk. Tapi sampai dengan investor masuk pasti harus ada privatisasi karena proposalnya kemarin privitisasi. Sekarang seperti apa, masih nunggu," kata Direktur Utama MNA Asep Eka Nugraha di Kementerian Badan Usaha Milik Negara (BUMN) Jakarta, Senin (4/11/2019).Dia menuturkan, pemerintah belum memberi restu untuk privatisasi. Dia melanjutkan, untuk privatisasi sendiri Merpati harus melakukan restukturisasi utang maupun bisnis Merpati."Belum ada kan emang (persetujuan). Kan di antara privatisasi kan ada restrukturisasi. Mana ada privatisasi sebelum ada restrukturisasi. Restrukturisasi diselesaikan dulu," jelasnya.Terkait rencana Merpati terbang lagi, Asep belum bisa menjelaskan secara rinci. Sebab, untuk menerbangkan kembali pesawat, pihaknya juga harus melakukan perhitungan sesuai dengan perdamaian (homologasi)."Setiap ada pergerakan pesawat Merpati terbang itu yang akan menjadi triger untuk grace period tentang penerapan homologasi on. Nah itu yang benar-benar harus dihitung oleh kita Garuda, bersama-sama termasuk agen restrukturisasi dan tim (Kementerian) BUMN mana yang benar bergerak dihitung mana yang akan men-triger on," jelasnya.Untuk benar-benar bisa terbang sendiri, Merpati saat ini menggandeng PT Garuda Indonesia (Persero) Tbk untuk bisnis kargo di Papua. Dalam kerja sama ini, Merpati akan memanfaatan satu pesawat Garuda pada tahap awal yang rencananya diluncurkan pada 10 November 2019 mendatang. Revealed! This Is Because Merpati Never Get Investor Injections
Nov 04 2019, 13:22 by Achmad Dwi Afriyadi


Photo: Infographics Team: Nadia Permatasari

Jakarta - PT Merpati Nusantara Airlines (Persero) or MNA has not flown until now. Because, to be able to fly Merpati must get capital injections from investors. Meanwhile, investors, namely PT Intra Asia Corpora who intend to inject capital of Rp 6.4 trillion, do not enter because there is no decision to release shares or privatization. "Yes, this is not a conclusion. "Yes, it's not privatization first, then investors come in. But until investors come in, there must be privatization because the proposal was privatized yesterday. Now it's like what, still waiting," said MNA President Director Asep Eka Nugraha at the Ministry of State-Owned Enterprises (SOEs) Jakarta, Monday. (4/11/2019). He said that the government had not yet given his blessing for privatization. He continued, for privatization, Merpati had to carry out debt restructuring and Merpati business. "There is no right yet (agreement). There is restructuring among privatization. Where there is privatization before restructuring. Restructuring is completed first," he explained. again, Asep could not explain in detail. Because, to fly the plane back, it must also do calculations in accordance with peace (homologation). "Every movement of the Merpati flight will be a triger for the grace period on the implementation of homologation on. Well, that really must be calculated by us Garuda , together with the restructuring agent and the SOE (Ministry) team, which is really moving is calculated which will be trigered on, "he explained. To truly be able to fly alone, Merpati is currently cooperating with PT Garuda Indonesia (Persero) Tbk for business cargo in Papua. In this collaboration, Merpati will utilize one Garuda aircraft in the initial stages planned to be launched on 10 November 2019.
